Package algorithms

This package gathers all the algorithms an agent can ask for.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ISelector All we ask an algorithm to be able to do is : Extract an action chosen among the list of possible moves Learn from its experience
IStrategy  
IStrategyLearner  
 

Class Summary
AbstractMemorySelector The base of all Q-Learning-like algorithms : Provides a structure to memorize or compute the Q(s,a) Contains all the parameters used in the Q-Learning update rules Contains all the parameters used to control convergence
AbstractQLambdaSelector Common settings and behaviors of Q(lambda) algorithms Sutton and Barto chap 7.6 page 182
Concrete implementations are following Watkin's or Peng's definitions.
HumanSelector A Generic (i.e. available for any problem) Human Player.
NNSelector A Neural Network is used to 'memorize' the Q(s,a) values.
NNSelectorSinglePass The underlying Neural Network does not memorize the past experiences, and only learns from the last experience.
PengNNSelector Algorithm : Peng & Williams Q(s,a) values stored/learnt/computed in a Neural Network
PengSelector Peng's implementation of Q(lambda)
Sutton and Barto chap 7.6 page 182
Reference : Peng et Williams 1996
QLearningSelector The basic Q-Learning algorithm.
QLIntegerSelector Experimental implementation of Compact Q-Learning algorithm : All numbers are integers, and can be restricted to bytes See the paper
RandomSelector A player which plays randomly There is no learning for this algorithm, it is just intended serve as benchmark.
TDFASelector A linear gradient-descent version of Watkins Q(lambda) SeeSutton & Barto p 213 Q-Learning and the erratum for the details.
WatkinsNNSelector Watkin's algorithm to manage and compute Q(s,a), but Q(s,a) are learned thanks to a Neural Network.
WatkinsNNSelectorSinglePass Watkin's algorithm to manage and compute Q(s,a), but Q(s,a) are learned thanks to a memoryless Neural Network.
WatkinsSelector Q(lambda), version Watkins
WinnerSelector A player which plays to win : If there is an action that leads to victory : Play it !
 

Package algorithms Description

This package gathers all the algorithms an agent can ask for.
